message.content:
To align a row of `div` elements to the right using Flexbox in CSS, you can follow these steps: 1. Set the parent container's display property to `flex`. 2. Set the flex-direction property to `row-reverse`. 3. Set the justify-content property to `space-between` or `flex-end` to distribute space between the items and align them to the right. Here's an example: HTML: ```html
Item 1
Item 2
Item 3
``` CSS: ```css .parent { display: flex; flex-direction: row-reverse; justify-content: space-between; } ``` In this example, the `parent` container's `flex-direction` is set to `row-reverse`, which will reverse the order of the items in the container. The `justify-content` property is set to `space-between` to distribute space between the items and align them to the right.
